intro: Caladenia australis, commonly known as the Southern Spider Orchid, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and delicate, spider-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as heathlands and woodlands. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by insects. Caladenia australis is a perennial herb that produces a single or few flowers per stem, often during late spring or early summer.
